newsitem.title: BELGIUM: BELGIUM MULLS LEADED CAR FUEL BAN FROM 2000.
newsitem.headline: BELGIUM MULLS LEADED CAR FUEL BAN FROM 2000.

text.p: Belgian State Secretary for the Environment Jan Peeters said on Monday he supported a proposed European Commission directive to ban the use of leaded petrol in cars from January 1, 2000.
He made the comment in an answer to a written question from a member of parliament.
The market share of leaded car fuel in Belgium was 31 percent in 1995, down from 92 percent in 1988.
